intro: Distemon ottonis, commonly known as the Otto's distemon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Distemon ottonis typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in botanical gardens and for landscape use.
